metadata.name: PUA - Fast Reverse Proxy (FRP) Execution
metadata.comment: Detects the use of Fast Reverse Proxy. frp is a fast reverse proxy to help you expose a local server behind a NAT or firewall to the Internet.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\frpc.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\frps.exe')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\frpc.ini')) OR contains(lower(process.file.hashes.value), lower('md5=7d9c233b8c9e3f0ea290d2b84593c842')) OR contains(lower(process.file.hashes.value), lower('sha1=06ddc9280e1f1810677935a2477012960905942f')) OR contains(lower(process.file.hashes.value), lower('sha256=57b0936b8d336d8e981c169466a15a5fd21a7d5a2c7daf62d5e142ee860e387c'))))

output.summary: Detects the use of Fast Reverse Proxy. frp is a fast reverse proxy to help you expose a local server behind a NAT or firewall to the Internet.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate use References: https://asec.ahnlab.com/en/38156/, https://github.com/fatedier/frp
